revised_title: Wind Structure in the Atmospheric Boundary Layer: A Discussion on Aeronautical Aerodynamics
tldr: This article discusses the wind structure in the atmospheric boundary layer, focusing on the variation of mean wind speed with height and the statistical properties of turbulent fluctuations. It also explores the effects of buildings and urban areas on local wind patterns and the travel and dispersion of pollutants. The article provides a comprehensive overview of the current state of knowledge on wind structure near the ground and its implications for architectural and aeronautical aerodynamics.
